task.title: Climate Tech Startup Investment Landscape 2024-2025
task.objective: Map the current climate tech startup ecosystem, identify high-potential sectors, and analyze investment trends to guide venture capital allocation strategy

context.background: Climate tech investment reached $70B in 2023 despite broader VC slowdown. Key areas include carbon capture, green hydrogen, sustainable aviation, and grid-scale storage. Policy tailwinds from IRA and EU Green Deal are accelerating deployment.
context.use_case: VC fund thesis development for $200M climate-focused fund
prior_knowledge: IRA provides significant tax incentives for clean energy
Carbon capture is gaining traction but economics remain challenging

questions.primary: Which climate tech sectors offer the best risk-adjusted returns for early-stage investment over the next 5 years?
secondary: What are the top-funded climate tech sectors in 2024?
Which sectors have the highest ratio of Series A+ to seed funding?
What policy mechanisms are most impactful for startup unit economics?
Which technologies are transitioning from lab to commercial scale?
What are the key risks by sector (technology, regulatory, market)?
hypotheses: Grid-scale storage will see highest growth due to renewable intermittency
Green hydrogen remains 3-5 years from commercial viability for most applications
Carbon capture DAC costs will not reach economic viability without policy support
exclusions: Mature renewable technologies (solar panels, onshore wind)

special_instructions: Include sector-by-sector analysis with investment data tables
Map key policy incentives (IRA, EU Green Deal) to specific sectors
Identify top 10 most-funded startups per sector
Note technology readiness levels (TRL) for emerging technologies
Highlight geographic concentrations of startup activity
